meanings.definition: Depriving someone of a right or privilege.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was disentitling the student from recess for misbehaving.
meanings.sent2: The court ruling disentitling the defendant from owning a firearm.
meanings.sent3: The magician disentitling the volunteer from choosing a card by making all the cards disappear.
meanings.sent4: The storm disentitling the town from electricity for days.
meanings.sent5: The lock disentitling the burglar from entering the house was unbreakable.

meanings.sent1: The new policy disentitling employees from receiving overtime pay.
meanings.sent2: Failing the background check disentitling the applicant from the job.
meanings.sent3: The broken elevator disentitling people from using it and forcing them to take the stairs.
meanings.sent4: The closed road disentitling drivers from reaching their destination quickly.
meanings.sent5: The expired coupon disentitling customers from getting a discount on their purchase.
